I bought this game on a Friday afternoon tired of the typical shoot-em-up that i was used to and after completing the tutorial i hopped on my first game, the first survivor i played was Jake park due to his resemblance to a friend anyways my first match was against a wraith i still remember that game because it was the moment i found my new favorite game, while not as scary as i would have been to believe but the gameplay is beyond good

The game itself is good; not perfect but overall good. The players, however, are trolling toxic jerks who will do anything to ruin the game for anyone else, be they teammate or opponent. The community is bitter, hateful, and immature. I used to love this game, but it's getting exponentially worse, and I can't tolerate it anymore. Everyone is either trying too hard, or outright trying to ruin each other's fun. Not a fun experience. Spend your money on literally anything else.

If you like games with a sweaty, toxic community and you are basically always on the grind then this is the game for you! Fr tho I love this game despite how toxic it can get sometimes. You need to put in a TON of time to get any progress and a ton of money if you want to actually have good characters and perks. So the price tag for the FULL game would be over $100. But obviously you can just take the base game but it is much harder to do with only that lol. Just saying though, I do love this game so fuckin much and I put in so much time playing.
foda

I have just a little over 500 hours on this game and I can respectfully say this is a awesome game. Now, I wont say perfect because there are couple flaws that this game brings with it, one of the bigger ones being the matchmaking system. However, I do think these problems can be easily fixed. Anyways, this game can be played on your own, but if you want the best possible experience I recommend playing with friends. If you don't have anyone to play with though, that is totally fine I just recommend playing the killer playlist instead of survivor. This is simply because not being able to communicate with your teammates when playing survivor can make the game really stressful at times. Overall, I think its a really fun game and for $20 (Excluding the DLCs) I don't think it is a bad purchase by any means.
waste of time and money

Ever since I started playing this game in 2021 it is by far the best gaming experience I've had in years and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is a fan of 4 vs 1 online gaming. It fits perfectly for me because I grew up as a fan of horror movies and it's great to actually play as the characters that are based off my favorite horror flicks.

Prestiged a character yesterday, felt good! I never thought this was a game I would care for, even as a horror lover but there is something addictive and complex that pulls you in. I loved it so much I bought a DLC 3 days after playing the game for the first time #JaneRomeroIsBae (cringe but whatever). Once you learn the basics the game is easy understand and the rest comes down to learning different skills. I haven't been playing for long but I recommend 100%. Thanks for coming to my DedTalk

This is the worst game I've ever played. Finally decided today to uninstall, yes, at EIGHT HUNDRED AND EIGHTEEN hours. Maybe in the beginning it was fun, but idk ,there's been a shift in the community as of late. Super toxic people / players, devs who don't care about anything but how much people are spending on cosmetics, and many many maaaany broken game mechanics. The balancing is awful, and for the love of god, do NOT go on this game's subreddit. Please, out of self respect, do not buy this game.

I used to love this game.  I'd play for hours. Far too many really.  I have decided to step away from it now.  The community is toxic, the developer doesn't care to balance it, and it's just boring.  Getting tunneled or camped on hook isn't fun. Getting body blocked or having 4 people sabotage hooks constantly isn't fun. If you stream, even without "TTV" in your name, the killer can attempt to look you up and stream snipe you.  Survivors can't do this because they can't see the killers name until they die in the round .  If you play killer, you get body blocked or a SWF (surviving with friends) group that flashlight every pallet or run 4x unbreakable or DS (decisive strike).  I won't say one side is better than the other because i played both killer and surv.  Yes, there are perks to counteract killer perks.  When those things work right that is. 
  Let's be honest though, the game is horribly broken.  MMR is a joke, you can be on beginner rank  and go against a killer that is top tier red rank (highest you can get).  Instead of actually fixing it the developer continues to just push out content to rake in more money.  No real improvement to the existing content.  You can argue "it's just a game", that's true.  Games are supposed to be fun though.  This game is just stale and I doubt anything will be done to make it better.
GOOD

So 107.8 hours recorded and ive already hit rank Iridescent III for killer can check screenshots for validation. So review will be center around killer gameplay.

So first out starting out. You do a pretty simple tutorial really don't teach you much more then basics rest you will have to learn as you go. If you want to play this game for fun tho im going to sadly let you know, people are very toxic. Survivors feel they always should win so as a killer if you breathe wrong your gonna have one being toxic to you.

So to avoid that ive made simple steps for you.
Step 1 - Be ruthless.
Step 2 - Show them their place
Step 3 - Say gg and leave cause they probably gonna spam how you ruined their life for being better then them.

Now lets talk about the rank climb experience and difficulty. Your going to run against suvivors who honestly will have better perks then you and even with 100 hours in i still go against suvivors who run the most meta perks. However again I have some simple steps to win your games.

Step 1 - Destroy them
Step 2 - show them why their best perks makes them look weak.
Step 3 - feel no remorse and show no mercy.

See once you break their minds most suvivors will dc rage quit ect, Honestly tho real talk its a fun game but yeah expect to run against suvivors who run best perks and complain when you run even no perks. But if you can look past the noob rage well you can have fun. 

Its a great game for what it has, sadly the community is a toxic cess pool full of gate keepers which is funny every video I found is like you need 100's of hours or 1000's of hours to hit a rank i achieved in 100 hours :D so you can do it if you put in the practice and believe in yourself. 

Also fyi if you want to main killer id highly recommend playing survivor as well cause both roles are fun and the best way to learn is play both roles. Survivors who never play killer stuck in ash and bronze. Killers who never play suvivors about at bronze level to. 

Oh and one last thing have fun. Its a competitive game but don't take it to seriously.
tem ghostface

I hate this game as much as I love it. This games makes me consider myself  a masochist. It hurts so good. Every time I launch it, it makes me just as soon want to never play it again and yet I return and return.
